content: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

content: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

content: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William B. Sprague

content: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Whether you think you can or think you can’t, you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

content: I know for sure that what we dwell on is who we become.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: I’ve missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

content: You must be the change you want to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Goethe

content: You can get everything in life you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: Whatever you do will be insignificant, but it is very important that you do it.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Desire is the starting point of all achievement, not a hope, not a wish, but a keen pulsating desire which transcends everything.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
author: Truman Capote

content: Vision without action is daydream. Action without vision is nightmare.
author: Japanese Proverb

content: In any situation, the best thing you can do is the right thing; the next best thing you can do is the wrong thing; the worst thing you can do is nothing.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: If you keep saying things are going to be bad, you have a chance of being a prophet.
author: Isaac B. Singer

content: Success consists of doing the common things of life uncommonly well
author: Unknown

content: Keep on going and the chances are you will stumble on something, perhaps when you are least expecting it. I have never heard of anyone stumbling on something sitting down.
author: Charles F. Kettering, Engineer and Inventor

content: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover
author: Mark Twain

content: Losers visualize the penalties of failure. Winners visualize the rewards of success.
author: Unknown

content: Some succeed because they are destined. Some succeed because they are determined.
author: Unknown

content: Experience is what you get when you don't get what you want.
author: Dan Stanford

content: Setting an example is not the main means of influencing others; it is the only means.
author: Albert Einstein

content: A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes.
author: Hugh Downs

content: If you're going to be able to look back on something and laugh about it, you might as well laugh about it now.
author: Marie Osmond

content: Remember that happiness is a way of travel, not a destination.
author: Roy Goodman

content: If you want to test your memory, try to recall what you were worrying about one year ago today.
author: E. Joseph Cossman

content: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: We judge of man's wisdom by his hope.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
author: Mark Twain

content: Age is an issue of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
author: Mark Twain

content: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it's time to pause and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

content: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
author: Mark Twain

content: The surest way not to fail is to determine to succeed.
author: Richard B. Sheridan

content: Take the first step in faith. You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

content: Act or accept.
author: Unanonymous

content: Many great ideas go unexecuted, and many great executioners are without ideas. One without the other is worthless.
author: Tim Blixseth

content: The world is more malleable than you think and it's waiting for you to hammer it into shape.
author: Bono

content: Sometimes you just got to give yourself what you wish someone else would give you.
author: Dr Phil

content: Motivation is a fire from within. If someone else tries to light that fire under you, chances are it will burn very briefly.
author: Stephen R. Covey

content: People become really quite remarkable when they start thinking that they can do things. When they believe in themselves they have the first secret of success.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

content: Whenever you find whole world against you just turn around and lead the world.
author: Anonymous

content: Being defeated is only a temporary condition; giving up is what makes it permanent.
author: Marilyn vos Savant, Author and Advice Columnist

content: I can't understand why people are frightened by new ideas. I'm frightened by old ones.
author: John Cage

content: Setting an example is not the main means of influencing others; it is the only means.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
author: Unknown

content: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Unknown

content: Anyone can do something when they WANT to do it. Really successful people do things when they don't want to do it.
author: Dr. Phil

content: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist, or accept the responsibility for changing them.
author: Dr. Denis Waitley

content: Success is the ability to go from failure to failure without losing your enthusiasm.
author: Sir Winston Churchill

content: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes but don't quit
author: Conrad Hilton

content: Attitudes are contagious. Make yours worth catching.
author: Unknown

content: Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

content: There are only two rules for being successful. One, figure out exactly what you want to do, and two, do it.
author: Mario Cuomo

content: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
author: Richard Bach

content: Vision doesn't usually come as a lightening bolt. Rather it comes as a slow crystallization of life challenges that we one day recognize as a beautiful diamond with great value to ourselves and others.
author: Dr. Michael Norwood

content: Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

content: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

content: Flops are a part of life's menu and I've never been a girl to miss out on any of the courses.
author: Rosalind Russell

content: Cause Change & Lead Accept Change & Survive Resist Change & Die
author: Ray Norda, Chairman, Novell

content: Winners lose much more often than losers. So if you keep losing but you're still trying, keep it up! You're right on track.
author: Matthew Keith Groves

content: An idea can turn to dust or magic, depending on the talent that rubs against it.
author: Bill Bernbach

content: An obstacle is often a stepping stone.
author: Prescott

content: Life is trying things to see if they work
author: Ray Bradbury

content: If you worry about yesterday's failures, then today's successes will be few.
author: Anonymous

content: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Dennis P. Kimbro

content: We are all inventors, each sailing out on a voyage of discovery, guided each by a private chart, of which there is no duplicate. The world is all gates, all opportunities.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: In matters of style, swim with the current; In matters of principle, stand like a rock.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: I think and think for months and years. Ninety-nine times, the conclusion is false. The hundredth time I am right.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Where the willingness is great, the difficulties cannot be great.
author: Machiavelli.

content: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: You are what you think about all day long.
author: Dr. Robert Schuller

content: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Success is not to be measured by the position someone has reached in life, but the obstacles he has overcome while trying to succeed.
author: Booker T. Washington

content: Talent is formed in solitude, character in the bustle of the world.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: To avoid criticism do nothing, say nothing, be nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: If you want to make your dreams come true, the first thing you have to do is wake up.
author: J.M. Power

content: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a da
author: Robert Frost

content: I’ve learned that no matter what happens, or how bad it seems today, life does go on, and it will be better tomorrow.
author: Maya Angelou

content: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
author: William James

content: When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard', I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?
author: Sydney Harris

content: Don't let life discourage you; everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was
author: Richard L. Evans

content: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: It goes on.
author: Robert Frost

content: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you stop to look fear in the face.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

content: Do first things first, and second things not at all.
author: Peter Drucker.

content: The only people who find what they are looking for in life are the fault finders.
author: Foster's Law

content: Defeat is not bitter unless you swallow it.
author: Joe Clark

content: I am an optimist. It does not seem too much use being anything else.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Positive anything is better than negative thinking.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: People seem not to see that their opinion of the world is also a confession of character.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Those who wish to sing, always find a song.
author: Swedish Proverb

content: If you're going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

content: The sun shines and warms and lights us and we have no curiosity to know why this is so; but we ask the reason of all evil, of pain, and hunger, and mosquitoes and silly people.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Life is a shipwreck but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.
author: Voltaire

content: Enduring habits I hate.... Yes, at the very bottom of my soul I feel grateful to all my misery and bouts of sickness and everything about me that is imperfect, because this sort of thing leaves me with a hundred backdoors through which I can escape from enduring habits.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche, The Gay Science, 1882

content: There is no education like adversity.
author: Disraeli

content: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Adversity introduces a man to himself.
author: Author Unknown
